body: definitely a bug, thanks for reporting

should work like this:

``` java
Pull pull = // ...
User assignee = new Issue.Smart(new Pull.Smart(pull).issue()).assignee();
```

we should introduce a new method `Issue.Smart.assignee()` in this ticket
@yegor256 yes, will do. @krzyk thank you for this ticket, your account was topped up for 15 mins, transaction ID: `36061292`
@lthuangiang this task is yours, please help (see our key [principles of work](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles)). If you have any technical questions, don't hesitate to ask right here
@lthuangiang This task's budget is **30 mins**. This is exactly how much will be paid when the problem explained above is solved. See [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles) for more information

@yegor256 @krzyk I didn't find `assignee` in json response. How can we get `assignee`?

API: http://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#get-a-single-pull-request
see my comment above, we should add `Issue.Smart.assignee()` method
@yegor256 I agree we should have `Issue.Smart.assignee()` method, but ticket reported that we don't have method to get assignee of pull request. I think that `Pull.assignee()` != `Issue.assignee()`.
it's exactly the same, pull request is an issue in Github
